answers.author: Shannon Andrews
answers.text:
Having consensus on a solid navigation structure is really critical.  Once the initial design is complete, it is very difficult and costly to make changes.  When I went through the process, we spent a lot of time and resources making sure the site looked good, but less time critically looking at its function.  We were dependent on the direction of a consultant, but it was clear their emphasis was on the design portion, leaving us to develop our own navigation, which was challenging.  It is also difficult to test out navigation without having the site functional.  I'm not sure how other consultants would guide that process.
